news.headline: Visa results beat estimates on resilient consumer spending
news.summary: (Reuters) -Visa's second-quarter results sailed past Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, as consumers shrugged off worries of a slowing economy to swipe cards on everything from travel to dining out, sending its shares up 2.7% after the bell.  U.S. consumer spending has remained remarkably resilient despite higher-for-longer interest rates, with Americans still looking to spend on big-ticket purchases and international travel.  Visa executives in a call with analysts said international travel continues to be healthy, particularly out of the key markets of the U.S. and Europe, but flagged that Asia-Pacific travel has been weak as the post-pandemic recovery continues to be slower than expected.

news.headline: Visa Scores an Earnings Beat. The Stock Pops.
news.summary: Visa  profit and revenue during its fiscal second quarter increased from a year ago, the company said on Tuesday, as solid travel and spending patterns continue to hold up in spite of hot inflation levels.  Visa  shares rose 3% in after-hours trading.  Stable consumer spending drove increases in overall payments volume and cross-border volume of 8% and 16%, respectively, from a year ago, Visa Chief Executive Ryan McInerney said in a statement.

news.headline: Visa Joins AWS Partner Network to Help Simplify Global Digital Payments
news.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, April 25, 2024--Visa (NYSE: V), a world leader in global digital payments, announced today it has joined the AWS Partner Network (APN), a global community that leverages AWS technologies, programs, expertise, and tools to build solutions and services for customers. Visa’s presence in the APN will help enable its partners and clients, including cloud-native fintechs, to access and integrate select Visa services more efficiently.
